alert.note: Alert for Prairie; Wibaux (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wibaux and southeastern Prairie Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 359 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles west of Carlyle, or 23 miles north of Baker, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wibaux, Carlyle, Saint Phillip and Yates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
